item.title: On L&T Chief's 90-Hour Workweek Call, Adar Poonawalla Says 'Even My Wife...' - News18
item.description:
Adar Poonawalla Responds to L&T Chief's 90-Hour Workweek Suggestion

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: News18

Adar Poonawalla, CEO of Serum Institute of India, supports work-life balance in response to calls for a 90-hour workweek made by L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan.

  • Poonawalla emphasizes the importance of work-life balance.
  • His comments followed Subrahmanyan's controversial statement suggesting employees work longer hours.
  • Industry reactions included support for non-traditional working hours and critiques of the work culture.
  • Poonawalla sarcastically remarked about how his wife enjoys spending time with him on Sundays.
‚ÄúEven my wife loves staring at me on Sundays.‚Äù - Adar Poonawalla

The growing discourse around work-life balance highlights differing perspectives in corporate culture, especially among influential leaders.

item.title: More children test positive for mumps in Alappuzha - The Hindu
item.description:
More children test positive for mumps in Alappuzha

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Local Health Report

The Alappuzha district is currently experiencing a rise in mumps infections among school students, prompting health officials to take action.

  • At least five students at Eramalloor and four at Punnapra have tested positive.
  • The total infections at Eramalloor school have risen to 28, including a previous outbreak affecting 23 students.
  • Schools in the area have been closed for 21 days due to the outbreak.
  • Surveillance and preventive measures have been intensified by health department officials.
  • Mumps is primarily a disease in children but can also affect adolescents and adults, causing swelling of the salivary glands.
Mumps is a contagious disease caused by a virus that primarily affects children but could also infect adolescents and adults.

This outbreak of mumps highlights the importance of vaccination and public health measures to control infectious diseases among school-aged children.

item.title: Ice Baths for Stress: New research says cold water could sharpen your mind and improve sleep - The Times of India
item.description:
Ice Baths for Stress: New research says cold water could sharpen your mind and improve sleep

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Recent research from the University of Central Lancashire reveals that regular cold-water immersion can enhance cognitive performance and improve sleep quality.

  • Study involved 13 healthy participants aged 21, immersing in 10¬∞C water for 10 minutes, three times a week.
  • Participants showed improved processing speed and better sleep by the third week.
  • Cold exposure may improve blood flow and promote relaxation.
  • Lead researcher Robert Allan emphasized that cold-water immersion can aid sleep, particularly during periods of sleep disturbances.
‚ÄúCold-water immersion helps with sleep, particularly during periods of pronounced sleep disturbances.‚Äù ‚Äì Robert Allan

Cold water therapy can enhance focus and productivity, and reduce symptoms of stress and anxiety by lowering inflammation and regulating hormones.

item.title: Fibre may help protect your gut from overgrowth of harmful bugs: Study - The Indian Express
item.description:
Fibre May Protect Gut Health Against Harmful Bacteria: New Study

Publication Date: (Date not provided), Source: Indian Express

This new study reveals how a healthy gut environment, influenced by diet, can inhibit harmful bacteria such as Enterobacteriaceae, offering insights into gut health management.

  • The study analyzed over 12,000 stool samples globally, indicating a strong link between gut microbiome composition and the presence of harmful bacteria.
  • Fatty acids produced by bacteria like Faecalibacterium are crucial in preventing the overgrowth of harmful microbes.
  • Co-colonisers of harmful bacteria demonstrate adaptability, suggesting that gut conditions play a significant role in bacterial survival.
  • Findings may lead to alternative methods for preventing infections without antibiotics by promoting beneficial bacteria instead.
  • The research highlights the need for further studies on global microbiome diversity and its implications for health.
‚ÄúInstead of killing harmful bacteria directly, we could boost the co-excluders or create diets that support their growth.‚Äù

This research underscores the importance of dietary fibres in maintaining gut health and could pave the way for new treatments targeting harmful bacteria.

item.title: ‚ÄòPeople in Maharashtra showed Sharad Pawar, Uddhav Thackeray their place‚Äô: Amit Shah‚Äôs dig over poll results - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Amit Shah Criticizes Sharad Pawar and Uddhav Thackeray After Maharashtra Poll Results

Publication Date: Jan 12, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Union Home Minister Amit Shah took a dig at Sharad Pawar and Uddhav Thackeray, stating that the recent Maharashtra assembly election results clearly showed them their place in the political landscape.

  • Shah emphasized that the results rejected the politics of dynasty and betrayal.
  • The BJP-led Mahayuti alliance secured a historic 233 seats in the assembly elections.
  • The Congress-led MVA won only 16 seats, while Thackeray's Shiv Sena secured 20 and Pawar‚Äôs NCP just 10.
‚ÄúPeople in Maharashtra showed that Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena is Balasaheb's Shiv Sena.‚Äù

Shah expressed confidence in winning upcoming elections and remarked that the opposition's confidence has been shaken by the defeat in Maharashtra.

item.title: Game Changer box office collection day 3 (updated live): Ram Charan-Shankar film crosses Indian 2 lifetime - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Game Changer box office collection day 3 (updated live): Shankar's Telugu debut crossed lifetime collections of his much-hyped Kamal Haasan-starrer.

Date: Jan 12, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Shankar‚Äôs maiden Telugu film Game Changer has crossed the lifetime collection of his previous film, Indian 2. As of 7 PM, the film has grossed ‚Çπ85.09 crore net in India.

  • On its opening day, Game Changer collected ‚Çπ51 crore net in India.
  • Day 2 showed a significant drop with a 57.65% decrease, earning only ‚Çπ21.6 crore net.
  • The film registered an 18.01% occupancy for its morning shows.
  • The competition includes Balakrishna‚Äôs Daaku Maharaaj and Venkatesh-starrer Sankranthiki Vasthunam.

‚ÄúThe film explores corruption in electoral politics with Suryah playing a corrupt politician.‚Äù

The film's performance has been underwhelming for a Sankranthi release, and its future collection remains uncertain as it faces competition from other films released during the festival season.

item.title: HMPV is not new; stay calm and follow basic precautions, say experts - Business Standard
item.description:
Experts Advise Calm Amid HMPV Detection in India

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Health News

Amid concerns over human metapneumovirus (HMPV) cases in India, health experts affirm that the virus is not new, emphasizing calmness and basic precautions.

  • HMPV typically spreads through the air, particularly in winter and early spring.
  • Common symptoms include cough, fever, fatigue, respiratory illness, sore throat, and body aches.
  • Good hygiene practices and vaccination are recommended to reduce transmission risk.
  • India's testing capacity has improved significantly due to the COVID-19 pandemic experience.
  • Experts discourage panic, noting that public awareness is key to minimizing HMPV spread.
‚ÄúHMPV is not a new virus; it was first identified in 2001. There‚Äôs no reason to panic. Understanding its symptoms, taking necessary precautions, and following testing protocols are critical.‚Äù - Dr. Aabid Amin Bhat

In conclusion, staying informed and practicing preventive health measures can contribute significantly to community resilience against health crises.

item.title: Gut microbiome's role in fighting infections: Study reveals how diet can impact risk - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gut Microbiome's Role in Fighting Infections: Study Reveals Dietary Impact

Posted on: Jan 12, 2025 | Source: ANI

A new study highlights how the composition of the gut microbiome can predict susceptibility to infections like Klebsiella pneumoniae and E.coli, suggesting that increasing fiber intake can enhance protection against these harmful bacteria.

  • The gut microbiome may influence the risk of potentially life-threatening infections.
  • Research analyzed stool samples from over 12,000 people worldwide to study gut microbiome signatures.
  • Fibers in diet promote beneficial gut bacteria that can fend off harmful bacteria.
  • Probiotics are less effective than dietary changes in altering gut health.
‚ÄúOur results suggest that what we eat is potentially very important in controlling the likelihood of infection with a range of bacteria, including E.coli and Klebsiella pneumoniae because this changes our gut environment to make it more hostile to invaders.‚Äù - Dr Alexandre Almeida

The findings point to the significance of dietary choices in promoting gut health and reducing the risk of serious infections.

item.title: Anand Mahindra on 90-hour work week debate: My wife is wonderful, I love staring at her - The Hindu
item.description:
Anand Mahindra Advocates for Quality Over Quantity in Work Hours

Date: January 12, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

During the National Youth Festival, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra responded to the ongoing debate on a proposed 90-hour work week, emphasizing the importance of work quality rather than the number of hours worked.

  • Mahindra highlighted that impactful work can be completed in as little as 10 hours.
  • He mentioned the significance of spending time with family and the need for diverse thinking in decision-making.
  • Mahindra quipped about his social media presence, attributing it to his love for his wife.
  • His comments came in response to controversial statements made by other industry leaders advocating for longer work hours.
‚ÄúMy point is we have to focus on the quality of work, not on the quantity of work.‚Äù - Anand Mahindra

In conclusion, Mahindra calls for a shift in focus from hours worked to the actual output, urging others in the industry to adopt a similar perspective.

item.title: Ramesh Bidhuri refutes AAP's 'BJP CM face' claim: 'Arvind Kejriwal accepted...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ramesh Bidhuri refutes AAP's 'BJP CM face' claim: 'Arvind Kejriwal accepted...'

Date: Jan 12, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Ramesh Bidhuri, the Bharatiya Janata Party's candidate for the Kalkaji assembly seat, refutes Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal's claim that he would be the BJP's chief ministerial face, stating that he is not a claimant for any post.

  • Bidhuri clarifies his loyalty to the BJP and dismisses the claim as misleading propaganda.
  • Kejriwal's statement is interpreted as an acceptance that the BJP will form a government in Delhi after upcoming elections.
  • Bidhuri highlights public dissatisfaction with Kejriwal's governance, citing issues like the liquor scam and infrastructure problems.
  • He urges voters to support the BJP in the upcoming elections.
‚ÄúBy making an announcement in my context, Arvind Kejriwal has accepted that the BJP government is coming to power in Delhi...‚Äù

The Delhi assembly elections are set for February 5, with results announced on February 8.

item.title: 'Baseless to refer me as BJP's CM face': Ramesh Bidhuri slams Arvind Kejriwal over 'misleading propaganda - The Times of India
item.description:
Baseless to refer me as BJP's CM face': Ramesh Bidhuri slams Arvind Kejriwal over 'misleading propaganda'

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The political landscape has intensified as Ramesh Bidhuri publicly refutes Arvind Kejriwal's claim regarding his association with the BJP.

  • Bidhuri claims that calls him BJP's Chief Ministerial candidate are groundless.
  • He criticizes Kejriwal for what he refers to as 'misleading propaganda'.
  • The political rivalry escalates amidst ongoing election campaigns.
‚ÄúThe allegations made against me are completely unfounded and part of a larger disinformation campaign.‚Äù

The encounter reflects the fierce competition and tactics employed in Indian politics, showcasing how public statements can shape perceptions.

item.title: Ajith Kumar‚Äôs team clinches 3rd place in Dubai 24H race; Madhavan hails him as ‚Äòthe one and only‚Äô. Watch - The Indian Express
item.description:
Ajith Kumar‚Äôs team clinches 3rd place in Dubai 24H race; Madhavan hails him as ‚Äòthe one and only‚Äô

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

Much to the delight of his fans, Tamil superstar Ajith Kumar has triumphed in the 24H Dubai 2025 endurance race, emerging with flying colours. This victory serves as a significant boost for both the actor and his fans, especially following his recent accident during training.

  • Ajith Kumar Racing by Bas Koeten secured 3rd place in the 991 category.
  • Ajith received the Spirit of the Race recognition in the GT4 category.
  • Madhavan praised Ajith on social media, calling him ‚Äúthe one and only‚Äù.
  • Images and videos of Ajith celebrating with family and teammates flooded social media after the race.
‚ÄúWhat a remarkable comeback after an accident due to a brake failure.‚Äù - Suresh Chandra, Ajith's manager

This victory not only showcases Ajith's resilience but also brings joy to his fans and the wider Tamil film community.

item.title: Donald Trump Inauguration Guest List: Who‚Äôs Invited, Who‚Äôs Not And Are VIP Passes Running Out? - News18
item.description:
Donald Trump's Inauguration Guest List: Who's Invited and VIP Passes Update

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: News18

US President-elect Donald Trump has invited several world leaders to his inauguration, marking a departure from traditional US foreign policy where such invitations are uncommon.

  • Trump invited Chinese President Xi Jinping, who may send an envoy.
  • External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will represent India.
  • Invited guests include leaders sharing Trump's political beliefs, such as Italy's Giorgia Meloni and El Salvador's Nayib Bukele.
  • VIP ticket sales have halted due to high demand; general admission is now required for attendees.
  • The inaugural committee has raised over $170 million, with expectations to exceed $200 million.
‚ÄúSpace is limited.‚Äù

The inauguration is set for January 20, with several influential figures from the tech industry expected to attend, amid reports of limited VIP access.

item.title: Greenland PM Ready To Speak To Trump, Denmark Sends Private Messages To US President-Elect - News18
item.description:
Greenland PM Ready To Speak To Trump, Denmark Sends Private Messages To US President-Elect

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: News18

Denmark has sent private messages to the US President-elect Donald Trump's team indicating a willingness to discuss enhancing security in Greenland.

  • Greenland Prime Minister Mute Egede is ready to converse with Trump following his prior comments about using military force to claim the resource-rich island.
  • Greenland, with a population of 57,000, is a self-governing territory of Denmark seeking more autonomy.
  • The Danish government intends to reassure Trump that his security concerns can be managed without claiming Greenland.
  • Egede emphasizes Greenland's desire for independence while maintaining cooperation with Denmark.
  • Denmark‚Äôs Prime Minister has requested a meeting with Trump, though it's not expected before his inauguration.
‚ÄúWe have a desire for independence, a desire to be the master of our own house ‚Ä¶ This is something everyone should respect.‚Äù

The communication indicates heightened diplomatic engagement regarding Greenland's status and international security relating to the island.

item.title: What is PIA's MACE feature - TechRadar
item.description:
What is PIA's MACE feature

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: TechRadar

The article explores MACE, a built-in ad blocker feature from Private Internet Access (PIA). MACE operates at the DNS level, blocking ads, trackers, and malware before they reach your device, providing enhanced privacy and resource efficiency.

  • MACE is an integrated ad, tracker, and malware blocker from PIA.
  • It operates at the DNS level, blocking unwanted content proactively.
  • The feature is beneficial for privacy, reducing ads, and protecting against malware.
  • MACE is available on most PIA client apps, except for Android due to Google‚Äôs restrictions.
  • Enabling MACE is a straightforward process within the PIA app settings.

Remember, MACE isn‚Äôt a comprehensive malware solution on its own and can‚Äôt replace an anti-virus engine.

MACE is a valuable addition to your security toolkit, working alongside other ad-blocking solutions, though it has limitations regarding its static blocklist and malware detection capabilities.

item.title: Game Changer worldwide box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan‚Äôs film sees massive dip, collects Rs 72.5 crore - The Indian Express
item.description:
Game Changer Box Office Collection Day 2: Major Dip in Earnings

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Game Changer, the new film starring Ram Charan and Kiara Advani, faced significant box office challenges after its release.

  • The film saw a major dip of 57.84% in collections on its second day.
  • On its first day, it earned Rs 51 crore, but only collected Rs 21.5 crore on day 2.
  • The total gross collection in India now stands at Rs 72.5 crore.
  • The Telugu version leads with Rs 53.95 crore, while the Hindi version has garnered Rs 14.5 crore.
‚ÄúThe king‚Äôs arrival is setting the box office ablaze ü§ôüèº #GameChanger takes a blockbuster opening at the BOX OFFICE üí•üí•‚Äù - Game Changer Twitter Account

The film, directed by Shankar, is part of a big-budget trend in South Cinema but has not met audience expectations.

item.title: Rate of HMPV infections in northern China declining: Health official - The Times of India
item.description:
Rate of HMPV infections in northern China declining: Health official

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The article discusses the decline in human metapneumovirus (HMPV) infections in northern China, as reported by health officials. The trend indicates a positive shift in the management of respiratory infections in the region.

  • HMPV infections are showing a decreasing trend in northern China.
  • Health officials attribute the decline to effective public health measures.
  • The article highlights the importance of continuous surveillance of respiratory infections.
‚ÄúThe decline in infections is a positive sign for public health.‚Äù

The health officials emphasize the need for ongoing monitoring to ensure the downward trend continues in combating respiratory illnesses.

item.title: In challenge to Amit Shah, Kejriwal says won‚Äôt contest Delhi polls if Centre assures houses for all slum-dwellers in court - The Indian Express
item.description:
Kejriwal Challenges Amit Shah Over Slum Housing in Delhi Elections

Date: January 12, 2025   Source: Indian Express

AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal has stated that he will not contest the Delhi elections unless the central government drops cases against slum demolitions and assures housing for evicted slum-dwellers.

  • Kejriwal positioned himself as the protector of slum residents.
  • He criticized BJP for exploiting slum residents during elections.
  • Kejriwal warned that voting for BJP would lead to further slum demolitions.
  • He challenged Amit Shah to commit to housing slum dwellers.
  • Kejriwal reported only 4,000 houses built for 400,000 slum residents under the current scheme.
‚ÄúIf you vote for BJP, it will be like signing your own suicide note.‚Äù

Kejriwal emphasizes the need for government accountability regarding slum housing, stating his intentions to protect slum residents in the upcoming elections.

item.title: TCS expects margin benefits as BSNL deal tapers; to create 25K-seat capacity in Bengaluru: CFO | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
TCS Anticipates Margin Growth Amid BSNL Deal Tapering and Plans for 25K New Seats in Bengaluru

Date: January 12, 2023 | Source: PTI

TCS's CFO, Samir Seksaria, highlights expected margin benefits as the BSNL deal tapers off, along with plans to expand operational capacity in Bengaluru.

  • Tapering of the BSNL deal expected to positively affect TCS margins.
  • Company plans to create a capacity of over 25,000 seats in Bengaluru.
  • Current operating profit margin stands at 24.5% for the December quarter.
  • TCS will compensate for the tapering BSNL revenue through other sources.
  • Plans to enter the aspirational profit margin band of 26-28% by FY26.
  • Company manages financial impacts of currency fluctuations via an active hedging program.
‚ÄúThe same program (BSNL) as it tapers down at a portfolio level, at an overall level, there would be a benefit which would come in (on margins)‚Äù - Samir Seksaria, CFO

The expansion plans and efficiencies expected from the tapering BSNL deal signal optimistic growth for TCS and its commitment to enhancing operational capacities in a competitive IT market.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah set to miss Champions Trophy group stage matches because of back swelling - The Indian Express
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Set to Miss Champions Trophy Group Stage Matches Due to Back Swelling

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

Indian bowler Jasprit Bumrah is expected to miss the group stage of the upcoming Champions Trophy due to swelling in his back. He will be undergoing monitoring at the National Cricket Academy in Bengaluru.

  • Bumrah has been advised to report to the National Cricket Academy for recovery monitoring.
  • The Champions Trophy starts on February 19, with matches in Karachi, Rawalpindi, Lahore, and Dubai.
  • Selectors are contemplating whether to include him in the main squad or as a reserve player.
  • Bumrah‚Äôs rehabilitation is expected to last for three weeks, and he should be match-fit by the first week of March.
  • His participation in the last group match against New Zealand on March 2 remains uncertain.
  • Bumrah has experienced back issues previously and missed 11 months of cricket due to surgery.
‚ÄúHe (Bumrah) will be going to NCA for his rehabilitation. The initial report says he doesn‚Äôt have a fracture but has swelling on his back.‚Äù

The Indian team management is cautious about Bumrah's workload, with his health being a priority for the team's performance in the upcoming tournament.

item.title: California wildfires live: 16 dead as Palisades Fire spreads eastward, strong dry winds to worsen - Hindustan Times
item.description:
California Wildfires: 16 Dead as Palisades Fire Spreads with Strong Winds

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

California is in the grip of unprecedented wildfires, which have led to at least 16 confirmed deaths and extensive property destruction. The Palisades Fire has spread rapidly, fueled by strong winds and ongoing dry conditions.

  • 16 fatalities reported, 13 individuals missing.
  • Over 12,000 structures damaged or destroyed due to six ongoing wildfires.
  • Worsening weather conditions predicted with Santa Ana winds expected to escalate risk levels.
  • Significant evacuation efforts in place, affecting over 150,000 residents.
  • Emergency services deployed, including firefighters from multiple states.
  • Loss of power for approximately 50,000 customers recently reported.
‚ÄúThe fires are still raging in L.A. The incompetent pols have no idea how to put them out. Thousands of magnificent houses are gone, and many more will soon be lost.‚Äù - Donald Trump

As firefighters continue their efforts amidst challenging conditions, the situation remains dire, with many residents awaiting news of their homes amid ongoing evacuations.

item.title: Devajit Saikia elected as BCCI secretary, Prabhtej Singh Bhatia is treasurer - The Hindu
item.description:
Devajit Saikia Elected as BCCI Secretary, Prabhtej Singh Bhatia Takes Role of Treasurer

Published on: January 12, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Devajit Saikia and Prabhtej Singh Bhatia were elected unopposed as secretary and treasurer of the BCCI during a Special General Meeting held on January 12, 2025.

  • Saikia, the incumbent joint-secretary, and Bhatia were the only candidates for their positions.
  • The election was formalized without the need for a vote due to their uncontested status.
  • The positions became vacant due to the resignations of Jay Shah and Ashish Shelar.
  • An election for the joint-secretary's post is expected within the next 45 days.
  • Saikia has been influential in Assam cricket since 2016 and developed the Barsapara Cricket Stadium.
  • Bhatia has experience in BCCI administration and comes from a family with a rich background in cricket governance.
‚ÄúSaikia has to strike a delicate balance along with national selectors regarding India‚Äôs men‚Äôs team‚Äôs transition.‚Äù

The election of Saikia and Bhatia marks a new chapter for BCCI, especially as they prepare for upcoming challenges in Indian cricket governance.
